title: How Scary Is Until Dawn: Rush of Blood on PS VR? - Kinda Funny Plays
description:
FULL DISCLOSURE
PLAYSTATION PROVIDED US WITH PLAYSTATION VR FOR REVIEW PURPOSES.

Please note, video is captured at a lower resolution than what the player sees when using PlayStation VR.

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/NoTaxation
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Colin Moriarty, and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

Background Wall Art by Orioto - https://www.facebook.com/OriotoPosters/

transcript_chunks.text: greetings and salutations welcome back to Kinda Funny Games My name is Colin Moriarty this is Tim Gettys uh today we're going to show you the game Until Dawn: Rush of Blood on PlayStation VR it's worth noting that our friends at Sony provided us both our headsets and all of our games so we thank our friends at Sony for that uh now Until Dawn: Rush of Blood is kind of a spin-off or like in the same universe as the really fantastic PlayStation 4 exclusive Until Dawn which came out in the summer of 2015 uh it's basically like a teen horror film we all loved that game very much you were excited about this since you saw it at a preview event Tim and so we gave you uh full reign here to kind of show everyone the game so I'm very excited about I mean this game was what what kind of sold me on PSVR the most I've always been a big fan of like light gun shooters and uh specifically there's a game called Carnival back in the day that me and Kev used to play at Round Table and uh it was pretty much this

I've always been a big fan of like light gun shooters and uh specifically there's a game called Carnival back in the day that me and Kev used to play at Round Table and uh it was pretty much this it was like a haunted Carnival and you had to like shoot everything but the VR just takes it to a whole new level uh I want to note that uh the first time I I actually screamed while playing VR was this game even just during the loading screen oh that's good uh the baby the no not the baby head uh the with like the intro screen where you're going down this hallway and like in your left there's like some things going on but then this thing pops out on the right it scared the hell out of me uh this game is extremely good at doing that and it's a lot of fun I what do you want to kind of start with this uh I mean I think we should go I think we should show the first stage St I I don't think we should show too deep into the game but I'll leave it up to you I mean whatever you want well you know
